title: ESG Scores
description:
The ESG score is a system used to evaluate a company's performance regarding environmental, social, and corporate governance issues. The ESG rating plays an important role in the EU sustainable finance market as it provides investors and financial institutions with information on investment strategies and risk management regarding ESG factors.

Companies with high ESG scores are generally associated with sustainable long-term financial performance, as a responsible approach to ESG factors can help reduce operational risks, improve reputation, and attract customers, capital, and funding.

Find out how the ESG score is calculated, what is considered a good ESG score, and other useful information on this topic.
